TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit StringValidatorAttribute extends System.Configuration.ConfigurationValidatorAttribute

Docs.summary: Declaratively instructs the .NET Framework to perform string validation on a configuration property. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks You use the <xref:System.Configuration.StringValidatorAttribute> to decorate a configuration property. This is to instruct the .NET Framework to validate the property using the <xref:System.Configuration.StringValidator> and pass to it the value of the decorating parameters.
You can apply <xref:System.Configuration.StringValidatorAttribute> objects to property types only.
## Examples The following example shows how to decorate the properties of a custom <xref:System.Configuration.ConfigurationSection> object using the <xref:System.Configuration.StringValidatorAttribute> object.
[!code-csharp[System.Configuration.ConfigurationValidatorAttributes#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Configuration.ConfigurationValidatorAttributes/CS/ConfigurationValidatorAttributes.cs#2)] [!code-vb[System.Configuration.ConfigurationValidatorAttributes#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Configuration.ConfigurationValidatorAttributes/VB/ConfigurationValidatorAttributes.vb#2)]

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format:
## Remarks You use this constructor in the attributed model to ensure that the value assigned to the configuration-element property is of a string type.
## Examples The following example shows how to use the <xref:System.Configuration.StringValidatorAttribute.%23ctor%2A> constructor.
[!code-csharp[System.Configuration.ConfigurationValidatorAttributes#3](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Configuration.ConfigurationValidatorAttributes/CS/ConfigurationValidatorAttributes.cs#3)] [!code-vb[System.Configuration.ConfigurationValidatorAttributes#3](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Configuration.ConfigurationValidatorAttributes/VB/ConfigurationValidatorAttributes.vb#3)]

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the invalid characters for the property.
Docs.value: The string that contains the set of characters that are not allowed for the property.

remarks.format:

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the maximum length allowed for the string to assign to the property.
Docs.value: An integer that indicates the maximum allowed length for the string to assign to the property.

Docs.summary: Gets an instance of the class.
Docs.value: A current settings in a validator instance.

remarks.format:
## Remarks You use the <xref:System.Configuration.StringValidatorAttribute.ValidatorInstance%2A> property to perform string validation by calling its <xref:System.Configuration.StringValidator.Validate%2A> method.
## Examples The following example shows how to use the <xref:System.Configuration.StringValidatorAttribute.ValidatorInstance%2A> property.
